crops.presented_by: I. B. Pole Evans, Chief, Division of Plant Industry, Department of Agriculture, Pretoria
crops.description: Plants of a cold-resistant variety collected at nearly 6,000 feet altitude in the high country around Johannesburg.

crops.presented_by: I. B. Pole Evans, Chief, Division of Plant Industry, Department of Agriculture, Pretoria
crops.description: Plants collected near Vereening, at nearly 3,000 feet altitude.

crops.presented_by: I. B. Pole Evans, Chief, Division of Plant Industry, Department of Agriculture, Pretoria
crops.description: Seed from the Rietondale Pasture Station, Pretoria.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: A stout bush a foot or more high, with linear-filiform leaves one-half to 11% inches long and numerous small yellow flower heads on slender stems an inch long.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: Members of this genus are small, rigid, shrubby plants with yellow flower heads.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: A rigid twiggy shrub with long erect branches and trifid leaves an inch or more long with linear lobes. The yellow flower heads are half an inch across.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: A rigid, much-branched shrub, 1 to 2 feet high, with thinly silky tufted linear leaves up to an inch long and chrysanthe- mumlike flowers having reddish or yellow disk flowers and white rays. It is said to be a valuable pasture plant for sheep.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: A dwarf shrub 1 to 3 feet high, with very small ovate or triangular, spirally arranged leaves and inconspicuous flowers.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: A much-branched, semishrubby perennial with fleshy leaves less than 1 inch long, varying from linear to ovate-oblong. The small inconspicuous flowers are borne in leafy racemes and are followed by 3- to 4-winged nutlike fruits.

crops.presented_by: Ellis Thomas, School of Agriculture, Grootfontein, Middleburg Cape
crops.description: A bushy shrub 1 to 3 feet high, with alternate linear leaves, entire or 3-toothed, and numerous small flower heads.

crops.presented_by: James C. Scarffe, San Pedro de Macoris
crops.description: Porvenir-30. An erect vigorous variety which becomes 7 to 9 feet high. It matures in 5 months, is fairly drought resistant, and has never been seen with mosaic.
